meta.name: description
meta.content: Nevada County Public Health Department is working closely with County departments such as the Office of Emergency Services and Environmental Health, California Department of Public Health (CDPH) and the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) to closely monitor the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), which originated in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China in December 2019.This is an emerging, rapidly evolving situation and Nevada County Public Health will provide updated information as it becomes available.

p.em:
Positive tests will include those who have died.
Counts will be updated as soon as we have new information.

div.p: To respond to community questions, Public Health has activated a Call Center with Connecting Point. Dial 2-1-1 or 1-833-DIAL211 (833-342-5211) to talk with a call center representative about any non-emergency and non-medical inquiries.

a.aria-label: California Public Health Essential Critical Infrastructure Workers Guidance PDF Download Opens in new window

img.alt: Guidance for Healthcare & First Responders Opens in new window

div.class: inner col col24 first last id51a564c2-865b-4388-9e76-025dcacf858b

h4.a: COVID-19 Symptom Tracker Now Available to Collect Community-level Data

div.div: If you or a loved one is experiencing symptoms that could be related to the COVID-19 virus, including headache, fever, cough, or other respiratory symptoms, please fill out the “Community Symptoms Report” survey online or by calling 1-833-DIAL211. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Efforts to Reach Individuals Experiencing Homelessness during COVID-19

div.div: Nevada County is partnering closely with the City of Grass Valley, Nevada City, Town of Truckee, and community partners to reach individuals experiencing homelessness during the COVID-19 pandemic. Read on...

h4.a: Public Health Officer Issues New Stay-at-Home Order for Nevada County to Clarify Local Questions

div.div: Nevada County Health Officer Dr. Ken Cutler has issued a new Order that clarifies and complements the statewide Stay-at-Home Order in order to address local questions and issues. This Order is in effect until rescinded. Read on...

h4.a: Public Health Officer Recommends Cloth Face Coverings in Addition to Healthy Hygiene Habits

div.div: In addition to healthy hygiene habits and physical distancing, given more recent evidence that people can transmit the virus before symptoms develop, Dr. Cutler encourages everyone to cover their faces when it is necessary to go out in public. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Officer Issues Self Isolation and Quarantine for COVID-19

div.div: In an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19 and to protect vulnerable individuals and to help prevent the local healthcare system from being overwhelmed, the Nevada County Health Officer, Dr. Ken Cutler, has issued two new separate, but related orders. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Reports the First COVID-19 Related Death

div.div: Nevada County Public Health is reporting the first Nevada County death related to the COVID-19 pandemic. For additional information on the Stay-at-Home Order and recommendations, please visit www.mynevadacounty.com/coronavirus. Read on...

h4.a: Stay Home & Save Lives from COVID-19

div.div: Nevada County Public Health needs your help in combating coronavirus in our community. At this critical time, you can make an important contribution to the battle against COVID-19 by sheltering in place. Read on...

h4.a: Gold Country Stage & Lift Service Alert

div.div: Due to issues surrounding COVID-19 including a 60 percent decrease in ridership, Gold Country Stage and Gold Country Lift will begin operating on a reduced service schedule. Read on...

h4.a: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act Frequently Asked Questions

div.div: The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act passed on Friday, March 27. The state of California issued a comprehensive Frequently Asked Questions document to help make sense of the new relief legislation. Read on...

h4.a: California State Parks Takes Additional Steps to Help Slow Down the Spread of COVID-19

div.div: California State Parks is temporarily closing vehicle access to 59 additional state parks and beaches to avoid dangerous visitation surges and help prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19). Read on...

h4.a: Supervisors Launch Nevada County COVID-19 Business Task Force

div.div: Last Friday, over seventy-five business and nonprofit leaders participated in a kick-off video call to launch the “Nevada County COVID-19 Business Task Force,” co-chaired by Board Chair Heidi Hall and Vice Chair Dan Miller. Read on...

h4.a: Interfaith Food Ministry Urgently Needs Volunteers

div.div: Interfaith Food Ministry is currently experiencing a shortage of volunteers due to the statewide Order to Stay at Home. Read on...

h4.a: All WIC Services are Available by Phone or Video Chat

div.div: All WIC services are available by phone or video chat. Community members should call their local clinic to enroll or certify, obtain future food benefits, reschedule, get breastfeeding help, or to get questions answered. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Reports Fourth Person with Confirmed COVID-19

div.div: The person who was diagnosed is an adult who resides in Eastern Nevada County, and self-isolated while symptomatic. California’s Stay-At-Home Order is more important than ever to help protect the community. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Clarifies "Stay-at-Home" for Short-term Rentals

div.div: Nevada County Health Officer, Dr. Ken Cutler, has issued a local Order to clarify that short-term lodging should not be used to house people for non-essential needs such as short-term vacation rentals, including hotels, motels, and condominiums. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Reports Third Person with Confirmed COVID-19

div.div: The adult, who resides in Western Nevada County, recently traveled outside the country. At this time, it appears COVID-19 was acquired during international travel. California’s Stay-At-Home Order is more important than ever to help protect the community. Read on...

img.alt: NewsFlash - CodeRED Shelter in Place Notice

h4.a: CodeRED Alert on Requirements of California’s Stay at Home Order on Tuesday Morning, March 24th

div.div: A CodeRED Alert will go to all Nevada County residents on Tuesday morning, March 24th, to inform everyone about the requirements of California's Stay at Home Order. Those subscribed to CodeRED will receive notifications staggered throughout the morning. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Reports Second Person with Confirmed COVID-19

div.div: This case appears to be a community transmission case. Community transmission is occurring in many parts of California and ­only reinforces the need for social distancing and California’s Stay-At-Home Order. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County’s Public Meeting Protocol in Response to Coronavirus COVID-19

div.div: Nevada County will continue to convene its regularly scheduled public meetings of the Board of Supervisors. The Board Supervisors will attend meetings remotely and will participate in the meeting to the same extent as if they were present. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Limits Public Counter Services and Temporarily Close Buildings Starting March 19th

div.div: To protect the community and slow the spread of COVID-19, the County of Nevada is temporarily closing County facilities to the public beginning Thursday, March 19th. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Reports First Confirmed Case of COVID-19

div.div: Nevada County is announcing its first laboratory confirmed case of COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The person is an adult, resides in Eastern County, and has been isolated at home. Read on...

h4.a: All Nevada County Libraries Temporarily Closed through April 12, 2020

div.div: Beginning March 16th, all Nevada County Library locations will be closed to the public through April 12th in an effort to slow the spread of coronavirus in our community. Various programs are being developed into virtual formats to be accessed from home. Nevada County Library's Open except...

h4.a: Nevada County Public Health Confirms 10 Persons Under Investigation for COVID-19

div.div: Nevada County has had ten persons under investigation for coronavirus, nine of whom have tested negative for COVID-19. The one that is currently under investigation is being tested, and there are still no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Nevada County. Read on...

h4.a: Nevada County Declares Local Health Emergency to Increase Coronavirus Response Resources

div.div: Nevada County is declaring a local health emergency and local emergency in response to the emerging, rapidly evolving situation and increasing spread of novel coronavirus and COVID-19. There are no known cases of coronavirus in Nevada County currently. Read on...

h4.a: 3/1 Update: Still No Cases of Coronavirus in Nevada County

div.div: There are no known cases of coronavirus in Nevada County currently. Local health care providers are partnering closely with Nevada County Public Health to be able to quickly respond if a possible coronavirus case were to happen here. Read on...

h4.a: Public Health Launches 211 Call Center and Updated Website to Encourage Community Preparedness

div.div: Coronavirus is an emerging, rapidly evolving situation and Public Health will provide local, updated information at www.mynevadacounty.com/coronavirus. Public Health has also activated Connecting Point's Call Center to answer community questions. Read on...

h4.a: 2/27 Update: No Cases of Coronavirus in Nevada County

div.div: The 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19) remains in the media and of concern to many, so the Nevada County Public Health Department created a new “News and Updates” tab on our website, in an effort to keep the community better informed. Read on...

img.alt: Coronavirus Home and Residence Disinfection Guidance NCDEH_Page_1_NewsFlash

h4.a: Cleaning Recommendations for Homes with Known/Suspected Coronavirus Infections

div.div: These recommendations are based on what is currently known about the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and will be updated as needed and as additional information becomes available. Recommendations are given for cleaning, laundry and disposal of waste. Read on...

h4.a: 1/28 Update: No Cases of Coronavirus in Nevada County

div.div: Due to recent inquiries and to promote the health and safety of residents, the Public Health Department is closely monitoring the recent coronavirus outbreak in China. There have been no suspected or confirmed cases of coronavirus in Nevada County. Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx
